meanings.definition: A person who has responsibility for taking care of or protecting something.
meanings.sent1: The custodians of the park ensure it stays clean and safe for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The custodians of the museum carefully preserve the ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The custodians of the treasure chest were two squirrels who kept hiding nuts inside.
meanings.sent4: She became the custodian of her family's traditions, passing them down to the next generation.
meanings.sent5: The custodians of the forest, the wise old owls, watched over the woodland with great care.

meanings.definition: A person who is in charge of a building or institution, typically a janitor or caretaker.
meanings.sent1: The custodians of the school make sure the classrooms are clean and tidy.
meanings.sent2: The custodians of the hospital work hard to maintain a sterile environment.
meanings.sent3: The custodians of the haunted house were actually friendly ghosts who loved to dust.
meanings.sent4: She was the custodian of the old library, holding the keys to its hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The custodians of the lighthouse kept the beacon shining bright through stormy nights.
